alert.note: Alert for Tillamook (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 11:29AM PST until December 06 at 3:31AM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Oregon... Wilson River near Tillamook affecting Tillamook County. For the Nw Oregon / Sw Washington Coast...including Willapa, Naselle, Vernonia, Covered Bridge near Rosburg, Foss, Tillamook, Tillamook, Beaver, Siletz, Tidewater, Mapleton...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wilson River near Tillamook. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...Above 16.5 feet, expect flooding to start in the Wilson River RV park east of Tillamook. Expect flooding of low areas on Hwy 101 and Hwy 6 in and near Tillamook, along with flooding of numerous low areas on rural roads and property in the area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 16.8 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening to 6.5 feet early Saturday morning. It will rise to 7.3 feet late Sunday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM PST.
